short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: This extension shows you a green label on a browser-action-icon when you access to a site that is in your white domain list.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension tells you if a current site domain is in your white list to make your web surfing safer.
It is important to know if a domain is correct and a site is safe before you input something important (e.g. your account informations in any sites).
But there are many phishings and fake domains make you make mistakes to recognize if a domain is safe or not. (e.g. "arnazon.com" is a fake domain of "amazon.com")
We need something to tell us if a domain is safe.

After installing this extension, the options page will be opened.
On that page, you can register domains that you think them safe.
After that, when you access to a site in your white list, the icon with green badge (labeled "OK") is shown in top-right of Chrome browser, otherwise only the icon without green badge is shown.
